labels.label: This flow downloads a dataset, writing it to a temporary table in TimescaleDB. This data is then written to the target table with the time offsets preserved, but re-based to the current time. This means that the data can be displayed in Grafana as if it were being streamed, whereas in fact the dashboard moves through "future" data that has already been persisted.

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.value: insert into conditions select now() + timesecs * interval '1 second' , timesecs , coppm , humidity , temperature , flowrate , heatervoltage , r1 , r2 , r3 , r4 , r5 , r6 , r7 , r8 , r9 , r10 , r11 , r12 , r13 , r14 from conditions_temp;
